message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of detecting and localizing objects in images referred to by natural language phrases, which is a problem at the intersection of computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CV and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories. The paper proposes a framework that leverages contextual information and relationships among neighboring phrases, which involves machine learning techniques such as regression and ranking, suggesting that cs.AI and cs.LG are also relevant sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with weakly-supervised learning, which involves transfer learning and knowledge transfer mechanisms, indicating that cs.IR is a possible sub-category as well.
